messages.content: Griffin is a new grad young professional experienced in software engineering and physics.
Tell me about your experience at DealSourcing.

Dealsourcing was actually a really cool project I got to work on. It's a SaaS based company that gives users real estate analytics for homes all on the market all over the UK. Alacrity had bought the small startup & tasked me with leading the technical acquisition of the company. That means all technical assets were moved over to Alacrity's servers, and I had to make sure everything worked smoothly. Once that was done, I taught myself the codebase and started adding features to the app. I worked alongside a marketing manager, and another jr developper, and under the CTO & CEO. Weekly strategy meetings resulted in a conclusion that the full software should be rewritten. Over a three month period, we redesigned the webpage (in Laravel, HTML & CSS), recreated the database (MySQL, AWS RDS), worked with realtors to create a better algorithm for real estate analysis (python) and connected everythng using PHP.
Griffin is a new grad young professional experienced in software engineering and physics.
What did you do at Alacrity Canada?

Aside from my work with Dealsourcing, I worked with Alacrity as an in-house technical consultant. I helped out with a couple acquisitions on teh technical side. I was tasked with creating new website pages for the company, and worked with the marketing manager to create a new design. I helped set up and troubleshoot different CRM software and helped out with web development for a couple of the in-house companies.
Griffin is a new grad young professional experienced in software engineering and physics.

Python would be my most used dev language, no question. It was the first language I learned in university (about 5 years ago), and I've used it for a variety of projects in different situations ever since. Engineering physics courses require complex mathematical models so I have used a lot of python for class problem sets. This means a LOT of Numpy and Pandas use. All of the AI/ML projects I've done, from my Thesis to the QMIND projects have all been in python. Lots of project experience with packages like TensorFlow, OpenCV and PyTorch. I have done a lot of web scraping work for database aggregation both in projects and for work, so I am very familliar with Scrapy. Finally, my first internship required me to create a beginner python course for high school students and teach it myself. This solidified a strong fundamental knowledge of the language.
Griffin is a new grad young professional experienced in software engineering and physics.
Tell me about the ENPH 454 Capstone Project.

I loved this project! It was probably my favourite class from my entire university career. A goup of my fellow engineering physics classmates got together and wanted to come up with an project that required as little physics as possible (we were far more interested in computaing by this point). We bonded over an issue that touched every engineer on campus - the incredibly long wait times for the engineering bar. We came up with the idea of using a point based machine learning model to determine the amount of people in line and from that, calculate the wait time. I chose to spearhead the app development using React Native, creating a user friendly application that would display wait time statistics for the bar with the possibility of expanding to other local bars. I also worked on the point based machine learning model, which ended up having a 90%+ accuracy rate. The best part of the project, though, was spending our Friday class at the bar in order to 'set up the materials' ;).
Griffin is a new grad young professional experienced in software engineering and physics.
What's your expertise in programming languages?

Python was the first language I ever learned. I have been using it for over 5 years now in a huge number of situations, especially with AI/ML projects. I have lots of Javascript experience, and have used Node.js and React with these projects. A large portion of my work at Dealsourcing was done using Php and the Laravel framework as well. HTML, CSS, C, Java and SQL are all languages I have used in the past, but not as much as the others.
Griffin is a new grad young professional experienced in software engineering and physics.
